com.badlogic.gdx.graphics
Interface Pixmap

public interface Pixmap

A Pixmap represents a plattform specific bitmap. On Android it encapsulates a Bitmap on the PC it encapsulates a BufferedImage. Various methods are available to manipulate the Pixmap. This uses the common bitmap coordinate system with the origin being in the top left corner and the y-axis pointing downwards.

Author:
mzechner

setColor

void setColor(float r,
              float g,
              float b,
              float a)
Sets the color for the following drawing operations.

Parameters:
r - The red component.
g - The green component.
b - The blue component.
a - The alpha component.

void fill()
Fills the complete bitmap with the currently set color.

drawRectangle

void drawRectangle(int x,
                   int y,
                   int width,
                   int height)
Draws a rectangle outline starting at x, y extending by width to the right and by height downwards (y-axis points downwards) using the current color and stroke width.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate
y - The y coordinate
width - The width in pixels
height - The height in pixels

drawPixmap

void drawPixmap(Pixmap Pixmap,
                int x,
                int y,
                int srcx,
                int srcy,
                int width,
                int height)
Draws an area form another Pixmap to this Pixmap.

Parameters:
Pixmap - The other Pixmap
x - The target x-coordinate
y - The target y-coordinate
srcx - The source x-coordinate
srcy - The source y-coordinate
width - The width of the area form the other Pixmap in pixels
height - The height of the area form the other Pixmap in pixles

fillRectangle

void fillRectangle(int x,
                   int y,
                   int width,
                   int height)
Fills a rectangle starting at x, y extending by width to the right and by height downwards (y-axis points downwards) using the current color.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate
y - The y coordinate
width - The width in pixels
height - The height in pixels

drawCircle

void drawCircle(int x,
                int y,
                int radius)
Draws a circle outline with the center at x,y and a radius using the current color and stroke width.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the center
y - The y-coordinate of the center
radius - The radius in pixels

fillCircle

void fillCircle(int x,
                int y,
                int radius)
Fills a circle with the center at x,y and a radius using the current color.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the center
y - The y-coordinate of the center
radius - The radius in pixels

getPixel

int getPixel(int x,
             int y)
Returns the 32-bit argb value of the pixel at x, y

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate
y - The y-coordinate
Returns:
The pixel color in 32-bit argb format.

getPixelRow

void getPixelRow(int[] pixels,
                 int y)
Returns the yth row of pixels form the Pixmap in the provided pixels array. The pixels array must have at least Pixmap.getWidth() elements. The values are returned as 32-bit argb values.

Parameters:
pixels - The array to store the pixels in.
y - The y-coordinate of the row.

getNativePixmap

java.lang.Object getNativePixmap()
Returns:
The native bitmap object that backs this interface, Bitmap on Android, BufferedImage on PC

getWidth

int getWidth()
Returns:
The width of the Pixmap in pixels.

getHeight

int getHeight()
Returns:
The height of the Pixmap in pixels.

dispose

void dispose()
Releases all resources associated with this Pixmap.
